column4: hm. I've installed Ubuntu on a 4GB memory stick, but I'm unable to boot it. am I toast if my BIOS doesn't seem to let me choose the USB memory stick as boot device?
Pretty much
do you know if most newer motherboards/bioses support booting off of such media?
I actually won't be booting it here at home, but at someone elses quite new homebuilt computer
No, I do not know for sure. But I would assume so.
Ubuntu is not the best distro to boot from a USB. It would be better to use DLS or Puppy Linux. If you either one with QEMU, you can even boot *inside* a Windows or Linux OS.
well, I really need to use Ubuntu Studio, the system is going to be used to record music onto an external USB hard drive
Did you try to install the LiveCD to the USB stick or are you trying to do a full system install?
I've done a full UbuntuStudio install onto the USB stick
it tried to install GRUB onto /dev/sdd (stick), but that failed for some reason
The best way to install on an external HD is to first remove all internal HD then boot the LiveCD, then install to the external HD. That way, GRUB will automatically install in the right location.
I can get you the link I used...
that'd entail removing all my internal drives... not an elegant way
Just open up your computer and unplug it. You don't need it to boot the LiveCD anyways.
unfortunately there's no livecd for ubuntustudio
alternative should do also.
that's what I installed
I dunno how it'd differ if I ripped out all my hard drives...
Remove your internal hardrives ensure that grub is installed in the correct location.
yeah. but I'll still not be able to boot it here seeing as how my bios doesn't support it. is a proper grub install necessary to boot it on a usb-boot-capable computer, you think?
I believe so
was it you that I spoke to earlier? I didn't find a way to reinstall grub using rescue. I tried running grub-installer in a terminal for the new disk, but it failed to start.
Hmm. I'm sorry. I don't know how to do that. The only way i've done it was in a fresh install. You can ask around though.
Here's a link that I followed: http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=3350119&postcount=5
